#include <stdio.h>

Functions

int rpmemlog_open (char *buf, size_t len, int realtime, void(*user_printf)(const char *fmt,...))
 "rpmemlog_open()" creates a descriptor by using given arguments.
int rpmemlog_close (int fd)
 "rpmemlog_close()" closes the descriptor.
int rpmemlog_printf (int fd, const char *fmt,...)
 "rpmemlog_printf()" prints a message into the ring buffer. If realtime flag is asserted, this message is printed by calling user_printf().
int rpmemlog_realtime (int fd, int on)
 "rpmemlog_realtime()" changes the realtime flag.
int rpmemlog_show_memlog (int fd)
 "rpmemlog_show_memlog()" prints the ring buffer.

Function Documentation

int rpmemlog_close ( int  fd  ) 

"rpmemlog_close()" closes the descriptor.

Parameters:
[in] fd The descriptor.
Returns:
It returns zero on success. On error, -1 is returned.

int rpmemlog_open ( char *  buf,
size_t  len,
int  realtime,
void(*)(const char *fmt,...)  user_printf 
)

"rpmemlog_open()" creates a descriptor by using given arguments.

Parameters:
[in] buf A ring buffer address. If NULL is specifiled, it will be allocated internally.
[in] len The length of the ring buffer.
[in] realtime If realtime is 0, rpmemlog_printf() only stores a message into ring buffer which can be printed by calling rpmemlog_show_memlog(). If not 0 , rpmemlog_printf() also calls user_printf() to print the message in real-time.
[in] user_printf A function pointer of your print function. If NULL, printf() in stdio.h is used internally.
Returns:
It returns a descriptor. On error, -1 is returned.

int rpmemlog_printf ( int  fd,
const char *  fmt,
  ... 
)

"rpmemlog_printf()" prints a message into the ring buffer. If realtime flag is asserted, this message is printed by calling user_printf().

Parameters:
[in] fd The descriptor.
[in] fmt A format string like the standard printf function in stdio.h.
Returns:
It returns the number of characters printed (excluding the null byte used to end output to strings). On error, -1 is returned.

int rpmemlog_realtime ( int  fd,
int  on 
)

"rpmemlog_realtime()" changes the realtime flag.

Parameters:
[in] fd The descriptor.
[in] on The real-time flag. See rpmemlog_open().
Returns:
It returns zero on success. On error, -1 is returned.

int rpmemlog_show_memlog ( int  fd  ) 

"rpmemlog_show_memlog()" prints the ring buffer.

Parameters:
[in] fd The descriptor.
Returns:
It returns zero on success. On error, -1 is returned.
